metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3956 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The sm_close_on_exec function in conf.c in sendmail before 8.14.9 has arguments in the wrong order, and consequently skips setting expected FD_CLOEXEC flags, which allows local users to access unintended high-numbered file descriptors via a custom mail-delivery program. It was discovery that sendmail has a vulnerability where it disclosure sensitive informations via a carfted message. An attacker could use it to retrieve it.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmilter1.0.1 - 8.14.4-7
rmail - 8.14.4-7
sendmail - 8.14.4-7
sendmail-base - 8.14.4-7
sendmail-bin - 8.14.4-7
sendmail-cf - 8.14.4-7
sensible-mda - 8.14.4-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sendmail package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.14.4-7').
